author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sleuths of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence on Monday seized 9.12 kg of gold bars worth about Rs. 2.67 crore and arrested a suspect who arrived by the Howrah-Chennai Mail at Chennai Central here.

Acting on specific intelligence, DRI teams kept track of some suspects who smuggled gold bars into India from Myanmar to Chennai. Following a tip-off, a team intercepted Maria Selvaraj who arrived from Howrah with a woman passenger.

He was in possession of the gold bars that were wrapped with adhesive tapes. The suspect confessed to having transported the smuggled gold for monetary consideration.

Selvaraj was arrested under the provisions of the Customs Act, 1962, and remanded in judicial custody.
title: 9.12 kg gold seized from train passenger
